references.paper_title: LightGCN: Simplifying and powering graph convolution network for recommendation
references.reason: This paper proposes LightGCN, a widely adopted baseline model for graph-based collaborative filtering, which is extensively analyzed and compared against in this paper.
This paper is one of the earliest works to introduce graph neural networks into collaborative filtering, laying the foundation for many subsequent studies including the current one.

references.paper_title: BPR: Bayesian personalized ranking from implicit feedback
references.reason: This paper introduces the Bayesian Personalized Ranking (BPR) loss function, a standard method used in collaborative filtering, which is employed and analyzed as a baseline in this paper.

references.paper_title: Matrix factorization techniques for recommender systems
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of matrix factorization methods in recommender systems, which are fundamental to this paper's approach and serve as a key baseline for comparison.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This paper introduces Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs), a foundational model in graph neural networks, whose message passing mechanism is central to the current paper's investigation and methodology.
